comment: This professor was amazing best Asian lectures.
Class was very straightforward, very understanding professor. Quizzes and tests were just like the study guide and course lectures, but you have to go to class to learn the material.

Professor Meng is, in my experience, one of the most dedicated instructors at KSU. He provides positive feedback, is incredibly kind, and jovial. I took this course over the summer and although it was labor-intensive, he's not a picky grader. Pros: Easy A, (do the work) Not a lot of lengthy reading (they are poems after all) Cons: group projects

This class was super easy and Dr. Meng is extremely friendly and kind. It's an easy A if you do the work. If you don't turn in your papers, he emails you and gives you an extension. He even accepted my paper two weeks late and still gave me a 90. He is very forgiving and understanding. Wish I could take him again. Truly great guy.
There's a quiz and group work in almost every class. The tests are exactly like the study guides that he gives. He's not a tough grader. You have 3 class presentations throughout the semester.
This class was hard but he was a great professor. Pay attention, show up, study guides ARE your exams. Take advantage of that. Not as hard as I anticipated.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: I took professor Meng for Chinese 1001 and 1002. I got an A in both classes. Really nice guy. He gives quizzes every class but they are manageable. The test is literally the study guide. Memorize the study guides before each test and you will get an A.
The best professor I've had so far for Chinese!
Pretty laid back and good sense of humor. Tests are hard, be sure to stay up on studying.

TAKE HIM NOW! Literally, Professor Meng is one of the best professors I have ever been lucky to take. He is a kind, quiet man with a good attitude and sense of humor. He is passionate about his students, and always looks for ways to help. Get the textbook and workbook, you use it every class and it's worth it. He's awesome.
Very genial and helpful professor. Classes are fun!

Great professor. I'd take him again if possible, and would suggest that others do so as well. He's clear on what he expects of the students in assignments and class participation, and doesn't spring ambush assignments/quizzes. Nice guy, to boot.

Dr. Meng is awesome.  He made the class fun and fairly easy.  His accent helps with the humor, and his perservance helped with a solid foundation for the Chinese language.  I look forward to taking him again and encourage anyone who wants to get a fairly easy headstart on Chinese to take Dr. Meng.

Excellent professor. If you want to learn Chinese, this is the professor to take. Dr. Meng is very patient and loves what he does. He's always prepared for class and is great with going out of his way to help you. You have to buy and use the book (a lot) to do well in this class!!!!
